definition: two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
erhua variant of 倆錢兒|俩钱儿[lia3 qian2 r5]
two bits/a small amount of money

sentences.english: Shawn boomed. "There is endless bounty there for both of us.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩低聲說，“那兒會給我們倆無盡的禮物。

sentences.english: The two dueled, transforming the office of politics into an arena of lightsaber combat.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆展開決鬥，把政府辦公室變成光劍格鬥場。

sentences.english: My sincere congratulations on this auspicious event of yours.
sentences.chinese: 值你倆大喜之日，謹致最誠摯的祝賀。

sentences.english: Have you ever smooched at the movies?
sentences.chinese: 你倆在這電影裏擁吻了嗎？

sentences.english: They both passed on their bacons at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆都同時把接力棒傳了過去。

sentences.english: I think that's because Baggio is our favorite star.
sentences.chinese: 我想那是因爲巴喬是我們倆最喜歡的球星的緣故吧。

sentences.english: We both had been sitting on the Longquan hill for whole day.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆坐在龍泉山上，整整一天沒有下來。

sentences.english: She stared towards them and they ran to his car and sped off.
sentences.chinese: 她緊盯着他們，他們倆嚇得趕緊跑進車開走了。

sentences.english: Shi Xiang summer Guanci apprehend came to see two people is exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 緝拿施襄夏的官差趕來，看到是精疲力竭的倆人。

sentences.english: I am very grateful to them. Thinking of them as confidants .
sentences.chinese: 我非常感激他們倆，感謝他們成爲我的知己。

sentences.english: Congratulations to you both and may the years ahead bring you continued joy and contentment.
sentences.chinese: 向你倆祝賀，願時間白叟賜賚你們長久的幸福和滿意。

sentences.english: We bumped into each other when we were shopping in the Trust Mart.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆都在好又多購物時，撞見了彼此。

sentences.english: The two stood there for a good while, not speaking.
sentences.chinese: 爺孫倆在那裏站了好一會兒，卻一句話都沒說。

sentences.english: So, it is a mountain that we are both climbing.
sentences.chinese: 因此這是一座我們倆都在攀越的山峯。

sentences.english: By this point I was freaked out too and we both started running.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，我也害怕了，於是我們倆都開始跑起來。

sentences.english: My mother rented two caused to both of us.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽給我們倆租了兩個冰車。

definition: modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
